title: Renal colic

fields.name: analgesia_plan
fields.label: Analgesia plan
fields.helpText: Include what to take regularly and what to use for breakthrough pain.
fields.presetDescription: Select a preset to insert into the analgesia plan.

presets.label: NSAID + paracetamol baseline
presets.value: Paracetamol regularly as directed (if safe for you), plus an anti-inflammatory (e.g. ibuprofen) with food if safe. Use stronger pain relief only as prescribed for breakthrough pain.

presets.label: NSAID-only option
presets.value: Ibuprofen or other anti-inflammatory as directed with food (if safe for you). Avoid other anti-inflammatories at the same time. Use prescribed rescue medication only if pain is severe.

presets.label: Opioid rescue option
presets.value: Paracetamol regularly as directed. Use prescribed opioid only if pain remains severe after regular analgesia. Do not drive or operate machinery after taking opioid medication.

fields.name: followup_plan
fields.label: Follow-up plan
fields.default: See your GP within 48–72 hours. If you were advised to have repeat imaging, arrange this as discussed.

disclaimer: This letter is general advice and does not replace follow-up with your usual clinician.
